title: Burns
dos: Cool the burn with running water for 10-20 minutes.
Remove tight items like rings or watches before swelling starts.
Cover with a clean, non-stick dressing.
donts: Do not apply butter, toothpaste, or oil.
Do not use ice directly on the burn.

title: Nosebleed
symptoms: Bleeding from one or both nostrils.
dos: Sit up straight and lean forward slightly.
Pinch the soft part of the nose for 10 minutes.
Apply a cold compress to the nose bridge.
donts: Do not tilt the head back.
Do not pack the nose with tissue or cotton.

title: Choking
symptoms: Unable to speak, breathing difficulty, clutching throat.
dos: Encourage coughing if the person can breathe.
Perform 5 back blows between shoulder blades.
If unsuccessful, perform Heimlich maneuver (abdominal thrusts).
donts: Do not slap the back when the person is coughing strongly.
Do not attempt mouth sweeps blindly.

title: Heart Attack
symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, sweating, nausea.
dos: Call emergency services immediately.
Help the person sit comfortably and stay calm.
Loosen tight clothing and give aspirin if not allergic.
donts: Do not give food or water.
Do not ignore mild chest painâ€”it can worsen.

title: Fainting
dos: Lay the person on their back and elevate legs.
Loosen tight clothing.
Check breathing and response.
donts: Do not splash water on their face.
Do not make them stand quickly after recovery.

title: Snake Bite
dos: Keep the person still and calm.
Immobilize the bitten limb below heart level.
Call emergency help immediately.
donts: Do not try to suck out the venom.
Do not apply ice or a tourniquet.

title: Severe Bleeding
dos: Apply firm pressure with a clean cloth.
Elevate the wound above heart level if possible.
Keep applying pressure until bleeding stops.
donts: Do not remove deeply embedded objects.

title: Heatstroke
symptoms: Hot skin, confusion, rapid pulse, fainting.
dos: Move the person to a cool place.
Remove excess clothing.
Cool with water, ice packs, or wet cloths.
donts: Do not give alcohol or caffeine.
Do not immerse in ice-cold water suddenly.
